author: Charles White
title: Trolls shamed for calling terrified Muslim woman a ‘monster’
text:
A visibily distressed woman has been attacked online (Picture Jamie Lorriman) Racists have been sharing a photo of a woman caught up in the Westminster terror attacks on Twitter.
Showing a woman in a brown headscarf, some Twitter users called her a ‘monster’ for being on her phone.
Vandals trash every room of house causing thousand of pounds of damage Yet Londoners pointed out white people were doing the same and she showed signs of being distressed.
The as-of-yet unidentified woman was snapped walking past a woman lying on the ground of Westminster Bridge.
A woman is on the phone, another is blowing her nose presumably from crying, and a man is standing with his hands in his pockets.
Flags were flown at half-mast today (Picture: REUTERS/Stefan Wermuth) But xenophobic Twitter users thought they would share their own interpretation of the photo.
Yet it didn’t take long for Londoners and other users to hit back.
Some pointed out that emergency services might have told people not to stop, she might have been telling family or friends she was safe, she could have been hiding her face from the scenes or she could have been too distressed to stay in the area.
The image started going viral when ‘proud American’ Texas Lone Star shared it on Twitter saying: ‘Muslim woman pays no mind to the terror attack, casually walks by a dying man while checking phone.’
He added: ‘#BanIslam’
Some mosques are already stepping up security in response to the terrorist attack being linked to Islam.
His tweets included: 
Muslim woman pays no mind to the terror attack, casually walks by a dying man while checking phone #PrayForLondon #Westminster #BanIslam pic.twitter.com/B83Jwno65t 
— Texas Lone Star (@SouthLoneStar) March 22, 2017 
The main difference between Muslims and Christians. #PrayForLondon #Parliament #Westminster pic.twitter.com/pefnYY090L 
— Texas Lone Star (@SouthLoneStar) March 22, 2017 

Sadly, some British users supported these views 
@djbsuffolk @SouthLoneStar Where does Donald Trump fit into this. At least Trump is man enough to try and stop them coming in to his country
— Lord_Of_The_Manor (@golding_terry) March 22, 2017 
@SouthLoneStar Karma will come visit her. Someone will post her name #PrayForLondon #Westminster #BanIslam pic.twitter.com/qfAkNfuVvD 
— DAM1120 (@DAM1120) March 22, 2017 

But the majority hit back 
@SouthLoneStar look closely and see the distress on her face. I refuse to believe that you cannot see beyond a headscarf. #compassionforall 
— Smeeta Khetarpaul (@Smeetatweets) March 22, 2017 
@SouthLoneStar she's literally hiding her face and looks upset; also a white woman behind her doing the same.
— grace (@gracieursel) March 22, 2017 
@SouthLoneStar This type of tweet is unnecessary and provokes hatred. Please think before you say tweet. You do not know what was happening.
— Eileen Shepherd (@Eileen_Shepherd) March 22, 2017 
@SouthLoneStar The fact that people keep saying this about this poor woman is making me sick to my stomach. Just because of her head scarf?.
— Sitara (@sitarabrushes) March 22, 2017 
@SouthLoneStar she looks terrified. Which she would be, most likely being British and bang in the middle of a terror attack.
— lisa scott (@L75A) March 22, 2017 
@SouthLoneStar you are a complete embarrassing mess of a person. Kindly crawl back to the pond you came out of,
Stupidity embodied.
— Dr Vicky Forster (@vickyyyf) March 22, 2017 
@vickyyyf @SouthLoneStar what about the picture showing a white man walking by? pic.twitter.com/tpWWpEXkJE
